definition: to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

sentences.english: When the band only played for 15 minutes, the fans felt they had been shortchanged.
sentences.chinese: 樂隊只演奏了15分鐘，粉絲們覺得自己受騙了。

sentences.english: Trust is the mother of deciet.
The key to avoiding this scam is awareness.
sentences.chinese: 爲防受騙，防患未然是關鍵。

sentences.english: I believe the thinking of people can progress, so as to avoid hoodwinked, you do » And ideals.
sentences.chinese: 我相信思考分析可以讓人進步，以免上當受騙，您呢？

sentences.english: It's a big problem if you get scammed.
sentences.chinese: 如果你上當受騙，那真是個大問題。
他表面上的柔順使人人受騙。

sentences.english: Soon I knew of approximately 50 investors in Aspen who had been stung.
sentences.chinese: 很快，我知道阿斯彭大約有50個投資者受騙了。

sentences.english: When people trust each other, they become vulnerable to cheats.
sentences.chinese: 當人們以誠相待時，他們很容易受騙。

sentences.english: He's not the Number1 man which's being get in which way.
sentences.chinese: 他並非第一個那樣上當受騙的人。

sentences.english: He was duped into giving them his credit card.
sentences.chinese: 他上當受騙把信用卡交給了他們。

sentences.english: Is his devoted audience more gullible than the President?
sentences.chinese: 康屏的那些忠實聽衆比奧巴馬更容易受騙麼？

sentences.english: I felt cheated, but I didn`t care.
sentences.chinese: 我有種受騙上當的感覺，但我不在乎。

sentences.english: The peasant felt the cow, went away, returned, always afraid of being cheated.
sentences.chinese: 農民摸摸那頭牛，走了又回來總怕上當受騙。

sentences.english: Prospective opinionators need to watch out for scams.
sentences.chinese: 有意發表調查意見的人必須小心受騙上當。

sentences.english: You wouldn't go coz you know it's a trap.
sentences.chinese: 你不會去，因爲你不會受騙上當。

definition: taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
a swindle/a trap/a racket/a scam/CL:場|场[chang3]
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
to refer sb to an agency (or hospital etc)/referral
to report a case to the authorities
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
